page.title: 11Poulner & the Junior School
page.content: {Poulner Junior School}has eight large classrooms and two smaller ones, designed on two floors. A square shaped assembly hall forms a central feature of the building.{Mr. Russell} has been headmaster since the school opened in{1968.}The first entry con- sisted of{187}pupils, aged{5}to{11.} The school grew to{300}and then divi- ded into two separate schools, the{ {infants}being accomodated in another building on the same campus. The present roll of the{juniors}is{340.} Since the school opened several quite large private estates have been built. Poulner now has a{shopping {centre,}two{veterinary surgeries,}an{ {ambulance station}and a{dentist.}There are two active{churches}and also the{ {Poulner Players}who put on plays and a Christmas pantomime. {
